body: I can take a look at this issue.

Hi @jpambrun, it seems that I cannot reproduce the error:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12961341/65000867-26470180-d8a2-11e9-953d-648ccd9f2008.png)

Still happens here. I still have the `static-files/static-files/static/` prefix for every request originating from the service worker.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/718384/65040984-b5e0c480-d923-11e9-93fe-58b98d05b3b4.png)

I am not sure how I could have broke this from the config/user side. I run it in kubernetes (see config below), then I use kubectl proxy to reach it. Everything is fine expect the urls used by the service worker. What's most is that it stalls all other requests for several seconds (with the default configuration, adding `-w 24` provide some relief as show in the screenshot) while these requests are pending. 

``` dockerfile
FROM python:3.6
RUN pip install mlflow==1.2.0 google-cloud-storage sqlalchemy psycopg2-binary
RUN mkdir -p /mlflow/
WORKDIR /mlflow/
EXPOSE 5000

ENV BACKEND_URI some_postgres_url
ENV ARTIFACT_ROOT some_gcs_bucket

CMD pwd && mlflow server -w 24 \
     --backend-store-uri ${BACKEND_URI} \
     --default-artifact-root ${ARTIFACT_ROOT} \
     --host 0.0.0.0
```
``` yaml
kind: Namespace
apiVersion: v1
metadata:
  name: mlflow
---
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  namespace: mlflow
  name: mlflow-deploy
spec:
  strategy:
    type: Recreate
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: mlflow
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: mlflow
    spec:
      containers:
        - name: mlflow
          image: image_from_provided_dockerfile
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          ports:
            - containerPort: 5000
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: mlflow-svc
  namespace: mlflow
  labels:
    app: mlflow
spec:
  ports:
    - name: http
      port: 80
      protocol: TCP
      targetPort: 5000
  selector:
    app: mlflow
```
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
Same issue here. Have you got a fix now? @jpambrun
Thank you for interacting with this issue! Removing the stale label!

I am still on 1.2 so I don't know if it affects 1.3. I don't know of a fix or workaround. Starting mlflow with more workers (w.g. `mlflow server -w 24`) makes it bearable. Otherwise the few workers are stalled for a long very time (300-400ms per file) replying with 404s.
